intro: Ossaea parvifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ossaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal or sandy habitats, often in dune environments. It produces small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Ossaea parvifolia is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
